intro: Cogswellia gormanii f. purpurea, commonly known as the Purple Cogswellia, is a rare and striking member of the Aizoaceae family. It is characterized by its unique, fleshy, and often spiny stems that display a striking purple hue. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming in late spring. Native to the arid regions of South Africa, it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires minimal water. Due to its rarity and horticultural appeal, it is a sought-after specimen among succulent enthusiasts.
